data.name: Baška - Zarok - Batomalj - Draga Bašćanska - Jurandvor - Baška
data.description: Easy track intended for beginners and recreational cyclists will take you around the attractive Bašćanska valley. From Zarok, you will ride up the bed of Suha Ričina or Vela Rika river, the only permanent water course on Adriatic islands. You pass the sculptures of Glagolitic letters and numerous pastures observed by herds of sheep that are an integral part of the island. Upon arrival in Bašćanska Draga, you turn right and continue in direction of Baška, taking the main road. You can visit the complex Sveta Lucija in which there is Bašćanska ploča.

data.name: Baška – Moon Plateau – Portafortuna – Baška
data.description: This technically demanding track is intended for active mountain cyclists but also those getting acquainted with this sport and hobby. After the start in Baška you will find a very attractive ascent to the Moon Plateau with its unique panorama of Baška. The gravel track continues on the plateau offering magnificent views of mountain Velebit and nearby islands. The landscape which varies from “moon surface” to gentle vine- growing fields and pastures will leave no one unimpressed.

data.name: Portafortuna - Vela Rika source - Portafortuna
data.description: Although not very long, this circular track will satisfy MTB cyclists with basic physical aptitude for dealing with moderately demanding terrain. Right after the start there is an almost 3 km long ascent after which you can have a rest riding on flat gravel track. The second half of the track consists of somewhat more demanding descent towards the source of river Vela Rika and the attractive hundred- year- old oak tree and an exciting singletrack following the river course which is always filled with water, offering additional charm and memorable experience.

data.name: Punat - Tri križi - Ulika - Marina - Punat
data.description: On this short, but extremely attractive track, you will enjoy riding by olive groves and drywalls with splendid views of Puntarska draga bay and the islet of Košljun. From the center of Punat you take the steep track up passing Tri križa (Three Crosses), to the crossroads on flat gravel track. From here the track starts descending- first on gravel and later on a more demanding singletrack all the way to the sea shore. This track is an excellent training opportunity for MTB cyclists, thanks to its steep ascents and action ride.

data.name: Prniba
data.description: Peninsula Prniba is an ideal destination for recreational cyclists, beginners and children. A network of gravel tracks, most of them in shade of pine trees, will really make you enjoy the ride. Islet Košljun with Franciscan monastery is nearby. In ancient times it was connected with peninsula Prniba. There are also numerous beaches and bays on the southern side of the peninsula, great for swimming or just quiet relaxation.

data.name: Krk - Polje - Kosić - Vrh - Dvori Sv. Jurja – Krk
data.description: A dynamic track through Krk hinterland intended for MTB cyclists who can combine a ride on moderately demanding terrains with autochthonous products. After the start in the center of Krk, the route takes you through Kimpi field and locality Kaštel from 15th century to the House of Krk Prosciutto in Vrh, where you can taste the first Croatian product that was awarded the certificate of protected geographical origin. After that, the route takes you through local fields and olive groves offering a view of the island of Cres and returning to Krk.

data.name: Punat - Tri križi – under Veli Vrh - Buka – Punat
data.description: Another short but attractive track which will show you real island karst. From the center of Punat an asphalt track leads to gravel ascent with more than 20% inclination at some points. After you reach the highest point of the track, it continues on fine gravel to the descending part which is quite demanding, i.e. intended for advanced cyclists in technical sense (enduro) so a spare inner tube is recommended.

data.name: Krk - Kornić - Kampelje - Muraj - Krk
data.description: This circular and not very demanding track may also be called “Following the Path of Golden Drops of Krk Treasure” since it follows the educational trail of that name almost in its entirety. The educational tables inform the walkers and cyclists on the olive, its products and production and other specific features of the island landscape. This interesting track is also characterized by attractive and dynamic configuration among drywalls and ancient olive groves.

data.name: Krk - Dvori Sv. Jurja - Nenadići - Kosić – Krk
data.description: From Krk you start your ride in the olive groves ascending to its hinterland and enjoying the view of neighbouring islands- Plavnik, Cres and Rab. The route requires average technical aptitude due to the configuration of the terrain. After a tour of the agricultural tourist estate Dvori Sv. Jurja, where you can have a drink or something to eat, you continue on some gravel paths and old carriage paths around the villages of Šotovento- the most western part of the island of Krk lying underneath some hills and naturally protected from the northern wind.

data.name: Milohnići - Glavotok - Tri hrasta (Čavlena) - Poljica - Pinezići - Milohnići
data.description: Attractive circular track intended for MTB recreational cyclists who prefer a dynamic configuration with a combination of gravel paths and old carriage ways. Going around Šotovento, the most western area of the island of Krk lying underneath some hills and naturally protected from northern wind, you will have a chance to see several- hundred- year old oak trees and revitalized Krk ponds.

data.name: Voz - Rudine - Njivice - Omišalj - Voz
data.description: Every MTB cyclist with basic fitness will enjoy this circular track along the most northern part of the island of Krk, in search of technically moderate track. A combination of dynamic terrain configuration, various foundations and ride by the sea will leave no cyclist unimpressed. If we add a visit to Biserujka cave and archaeological locality Mirine, the enjoyment is guaranteed.

data.name: Omišalj - Mirine - Jezero - Omišalj
data.description: An attractive route in Omišalj area, whose historic city center rises on an 85- m- high cliff and offers a spectacular experience of special cultural- historic heritage. Riding on this easy route with moderately demanding terrain and almost unnoticeable short ascents, you will have a chance to combine the sightseeing of archaeological localities from ancient times with the largest fresh- water habitat of the island of Krk.

data.name: Omišalj - Njivice - Jezero - Omišalj
data.description: Although not very long, this circular track will satisfy MTB recreational cyclists who like a dynamic configuration of terrain with short but step ascents and descents on moderately demanding foundations. The ride from Omišalj and back to Njivice through typical island vegetation and the largest fresh- water habitat of the island of Krk may serve as good training or addition to some other MTB track.

data.name: Omišalj - Voz - Rudine – Omišalj
data.description: Circular track taking you along the ridge of the eastern part of the island of Krk with panoramic view of Crikvenica Riviera and peaks in Gorski kotar may prove very attractive. If you add a 140-year-old lighthouse Vošćica, Biserujka cave, island karst and landscape, we are sure that all MTB cyclists with basic physical fitness will enjoy this track, along with the possibility to master interesting singletracks.

data.name: Vrbnik - Risika - Garica - Kampelje - Vrbnik
data.description: This track offers a panoramic view of the field of Vrbnička Žlahtina vine and is intended for trekking cyclists of moderate physical aptitude. After the start in Vrbnik and initial warm-up by the sea, there is a more demanding ascent to Frankopan castle Gradec. You continue along a dynamic switching of different terrains through the villages of Vrbnik hinterland. Soon you will find yourself above Vrbnik field and enjoy the view of fertile vineyards and, so many times celebrated in songs, the town of Vrbnik.

data.name: Vrbnik - Risika - Sv. Marak - Vrbnik
data.description: In case you are a trekking cyclist with basic physical and technical preparation, this route is tailor- made for you. Upon start you immediately begin an easy ascent and with every meter you gain a more attractive view of Vrbnik field and Vinodol channel. Once you reach the highest point on the 4th kilometre, there comes a combination of side paths and roads which will gently take you to the shore and the beach where you can refresh yourself before the last ascent and return to Vrbnik.

data.name: Čižići - Rudine - Gabonjin - Dobrinj - Šilo - Čižići
data.description: This tour may be called royal or epic tour of the island of Krk. A bit more than 50 km along the northern part of the island will offer you a unique experience of Dobrinj area- from great panoramas, through numerous olive groves to medicinal mud in Soline bay. The route is intended for fit MTB cyclists ready to ride on more demanding terrain with long ascents and descents.

data.name: Klimno - Dobrinj - Dolovo - Gradec - Risika - Klimno
data.description: If you prefer tracks which demand an advanced riding technique, then this route is made for you. After the start and a rather long ascent to Dobrinj, there follows a ride on old gravels paths and forest trails which turn to attractive single tracks. Riding through abandoned villages and other almost forgotten trails of ancient history, you will link the recreational and cultural interests.

data.name: Šilo - Risika - Gradec - Gabonjin - Dobrinj - Šilo
data.description: If you are a MTB cyclist of average fitness in search of not very demanding terrain, this is a route for you. You will be able to research the laid-back paths and gravel roads through olive groves which will please all those who prefer uninhabited areas and pure nature. The ride from Šilo, on the coast, to Dobrinj- a city- museum, long- time administrative, religious and cultural center and back, will make this route unique.

data.name: Malinska - Porat - Fumak - Sv. Anton - Oštrobradić – Malinska
data.description: Attractive undemanding circular track is intended for MTB and trekking cyclists looking for an easy ride and discovering of hidden details in Malinska and Dubašljanski bay. From the center of Malinska you start in direction of Porat where you can have a look of the St. Mary Magdalene complex from 15th century and continue to Fumak- a hill with a large crucifix. The route takes you by the old cemetery to the highest point in Strilčić where you can enjoy the panorama of Rijeka bay and head back to Malinska.

data.name: Radići - Old cemetery - Rasopasno - Strilčić - Radići
data.description: Each MTB cyclist of basic fitness searching for a technically moderate track will enjoy this ride. It takes you on gravel roads, old carriage paths and forest trails through abandoned villages and belvederes from where you can admire the view of the larger part of Kvarner bay. Thsese are some of the reasons that speak for this track.

data.name: Porat - Fumak - Čavlena - Turčić - Porat
data.description: The track is intended for MTB cyclists with average aptitude and technical preparation. It will take you along the western part of Dubašnica. From Porat, through Fumak and Čavlena bay, where you can refresh yourself in summer months, this route will give you insight in everyday life of rural island of Krk. Long gravel paths with several technically demanding segments will simply disappear under your wheels while you are enjoying the views of olive groves, pastures and old oak trees, after which this area was named.

data.name: Punat - Krk - Malinska
data.description: An easy cycling route appropriate for families with children. It starts in Punat, one of the largest nautical centers, towards Malinska. Punat is also the center of olive growing so do not miss the visit to gallery Toš- space where olives used to be ground manually, today a valuable gallery. You mustn’t miss the islet of Košljun where for centuries the monks have preserved many valuables. This track gives you the opportunity to research the rich cultural- historic heritage of the island.

data.name: Krk - Oštrobradići - Sv. Vid - Kras - Kampelje - Krk
data.description: The route starts in the city of Krk and after 2 km it merges with a separate cycling path leading all the way to where the road turns to Valbiska. It continues through picturesque villages above Malinska, to the village of Sveti Vid. After that the track gently ascends to the heart of the island, to Gabonjin and Kras. The descent leads to Garica and Vrbnik field, Punat bay and locality Dunat. Taking the cycling path, riding by olive groves and enjoying the view of Punat bay with the islet of Košljun, you will return to the city of Krk.

data.name: Krk - Kosić - Bajčići - Brzac - Linardići - Vrh - Krk
data.description: The circular track takes you from the city of Krk to Šotovento- the most western part of the island. Hills which surround the area form a natural protection from wind, which is reflected in the name of this area (under wind). From Linardići the road descends towards Milohnići and further on to Vrh. Vrh is known for production of prosciutto and here you can learn its story but also taste this delicacy.

data.name: Omišalj - Čižići -  Rasopasno - Kras - Gabonjin - Njivice - Omišalj
data.description: From Omišalj, whose city center dominates on an 85-m- high cliff, the cycling route leads by the sea towards Pušća bay. After a short ride on main island road, you will turn to a road leading to Soline, situated on the eastern part of the island. This bay is famous for medicinal mud. After a break, there is an 8- km- long ascent towards Kras. On your way, you can learn more about drywalls, cisterns and sheep stables. End your ride visiting the remains of early Christian basilica from 5th century and roman municipium Fulfinium.

data.name: Vrbnik - Risika - Dobrinj - Kras - Kornić - Vrbnik
data.description: The route starts in Vrbnik, the cradle of literacy. It continues ascending in direction of Dobrinj and all the way to Kras. Make sure to stop in Dobrinj, a village buzzing in the spirit of past times and play sopele, the autochthonous wind instrument. The descent takes you through the villages of Lakmartin, Muraj and Kornić to Dunat in Punat bay, with a church of St. Dunat. The last ascent towards Vrbnik will be made easier by the aroma of grapes in Vrbnik vineyards and a well- deserved glass of golden wine- Žlahtina.

data.name: Šilo - Risika - Kras - Rasopasno - Klimno - Šilo
data.description: Circular undemanding track starts in Šilo, the cradle of Krk parachuting association, towards Risika, with a constant ascent to the village of Kras, the highest settlement on the island. You will ride through picturesque villages Rasopasno and Gabonjin, villages of preserved rural architecture and top quality touristic accommodation. There follows a descent to Soline, known in pre- Roman salt pans and medicinal mud. Enjoy the view of Crikvenica Riviera when returning to Šilo.
